intro: Boechera pendulocarpa, commonly known as the pendulous rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with clusters of small, white, four-petaled flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are alternate, lobed, and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Boechera pendulocarpa thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
